subject: ARABLANG
title: First-Year Arabic, First Quarter
description: (Formerly AMELANG 1A.) One-year sequence designed to develop beginning proficiency, with additional emphasis is on reading and writing standard Arabic.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Accelerated First-Year Arabic, Part I
description: Completes first-year sequence in two rather than three quarters.

subject: ARABLANG
title: First-Year Arabic, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of ARABLANG1. One-year sequence designed to develop beginning proficiency, with additional emphasis  on reading and writing standard Arabic. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 1.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Accelerated First-Year Arabic, Part II
description: Completes first-year sequence in two rather than three quarters.  Prerequisite: Placement Test, completion of ARABLANG 1A.  This course fulfills the University Foreign Language Requirement.

subject: ARABLANG
title: First-Year Arabic, Third Quarter
description: (Formerly AMELANG 1C.) Continuation of ARABLANG 2.  One-year sequence designed to develop beginning proficiency, with additional emphasis on reading and writing standard Arabic. Fulfills the University Foreign Language Requirement. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 2.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Arabic Calligraphy
description: Arabic calligraphy is the supreme art of the Islamic world. Other Islamic arts, such as architecture, metal work, ceramics, glass, and textiles, draw on calligraphy as their principal source of embellishment. Interactive lecture-workshop sketches Arabic calligraphy's development and illustrates the various types of Arabic calligraphy in use today use. Prerequisite: Knowledge of Arabic writing and reading required. May be repeated 3 times for credit.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Second-Year Arabic, First Quarter
description: (Formerly AMELANG 11A.) One-year sequence designed to develop intermediate proficiency, with additional emphasis on functional applications and reading and writing standard Arabic. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 3.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Accelerated Second-Year Arabic, Part I
description: Completes second-year sequence in two rather than three quarters. For students with previous knowledge of Arabic. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 2A or 3.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Second-Year Arabic for Heritage Learners, First Quarter
description: For students with home background or study/living experience in the Arab world. Designed to develop reading, writing, speaking and listening abilities in Arabic, as well as cultural knowledge. The course offers Arabic heritage and semi-heritage learners an opportunity to reactivate and expand their skills while studying both Modern Standard and Colloquial Arabic  formally in an academic setting. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 3H.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Second-Year Arabic, Second Quarter
description: (Formerly AMELANG 11B.) Continuation of ARABLANG 21. One-year sequence designed to develop intermediate proficiency, with additional emphasis on functional applications and reading and writing standard Arabic. Prerequisite:Placement Test, ARABLANG 21.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Accelerated second-Year Arabic, Part II
description: Completes Second-year sequence in two rather than three quarters. For students with previous knowledge of Arabic. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 21A.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Second-Year Arabic for Heritage Learners, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of ARABLANG 21H. For students with home background or study/living experience in the Arab world. Designed to develop reading, writing, speaking and listening abilities in Arabic, as well as cultural knowledge. The course offers Arabic heritage and semi-heritage learners an opportunity to reactivate and expand their skills while studying both Modern Standard and Colloquial Arabic formally in an academic setting. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 21H.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Second-Year Arabic, Third Quarter
description: (Formerly AMELANG 11C.) Continuation of ARABLANG 22. One-year sequence designed to develop intermediate proficiency, with additional emphasis on functional applications and reading and writing standard Arabic. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 22.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Arabic Skills Workshop
description: Emphasis on the necessary Arabic skills (Reading, Writing, Listening, Speaking) needed by students to use Arabic at the Advanced level. The course is designed to deal with more complex texts and selected authentic audio materials of different styles and genres. Prerequisite: three years of Arabic or instructor's permission. This course is repeatable

subject: ARABLANG
title: Arabic of the Qur'an
description: This course will introduce students to the definition, revelation, writing, organization and collection of the Qur'an. The goal will be to introduce students to the basic knowledge and the skills of reading the language of the Qur'an as one of the most authentic and widely read classical Arabic texts for hundreds of years The course is meant for students at the intermediate to native speaker¿s level of Arabic. It is suitable for anyone interested in the Arabic language, Islam, or the Middle East and its history. This is a language course, not a course on theology.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Colloquial Arabic, First Quarter
description: (Formerly AMELANG 25A.) Sources include authentic videotaped conversations with native speakers, conversations, and texts of these conversations to enhance comprehension and improve aural skills. Prerequisite: 2 years of Arabic. May be repeated for credit.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Colloquial Arabic, Second Quarter
description: Formerly AMELANG 25B.) Continuation of ARABLANG 125A. Sources include authentic videotaped conversations with native speakers, conversations, and texts of these conversations to enhance comprehension and improve aural skills. Prerequisite: ARABLANG 125AMay be repeated for credit

subject: ARABLANG
title: Colloquial Arabic, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of ARABLANG 125B. Sources include authentic videotaped conversations with native speakers, conversations, and texts of these conversations to enhance comprehension and improve aural skills. Prerequisite: ARABLANG 125B. May be repeated for credit

subject: ARABLANG
title: Intermediate to Advanced  Conversation
description: Students develop communication skills (listening and speaking) in Arabic while discussing real-life issues, current events, and cultural topics.  Pronunciation, vocabulary development, and group discussion skills are stressed. May be taken concurrently with other Arabic courses. Prerequisite: Completion of First-Year Arabic.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Third-Year Arabic, First Quarter
description: (Formerly AMELANG 21A.) Continuation of ARABLANG 23. One-year sequence designed to develop advanced proficiency with emphasis on complex and compound sentences through use of literary works, media Arabic, the Internet, and cultural productions. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 23.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Third-Year Arabic for Heritage Learners, First Quarter
description: Continuation of ARABLANG 23H. For students with home background or study/living experience in the Arab world. Designed to develop reading, writing, speaking and listening abilities in Arabic, as well as cultural knowledge. The course offers Arabic heritage and semi-heritage learners an opportunity to reactivate and expand their skills while studying both Modern Standard and Colloquial Arabic formally in an academic setting. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG23H.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Third-Year Arabic, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of ARABLANG 131. One-year sequence designed to develop advanced proficiency with emphasis on complex and compound sentences through use of literary works, media Arabic, the Internet, and cultural productions. Prerequisite: Placement Test, Arablang 131

subject: ARABLANG
title: Third-Year Arabic, Third Quarter
description: (Formerly AMELANG 21C.) Continuation of ARABLANG 132. One-year sequence designed to develop advanced proficiency with emphasis on complex and compound sentences through use of literary works, media Arabic, the Internet, and cultural productions. Prerequisite: Placement Test, ARABLANG 132.

subject: ARABLANG
title: Graduate Studies in Arabic Conversation
description: Prerequisite: Consent of Instructor

subject: ARABLANG
title: Graduate Studies in Arabic
description: Prerequisite: Consent of instructor. Restricted to Grad students
